title: The Oxford handbook of Latin American political economy
subject: Latin America -- Economic policy
Latin America -- Economic conditions -- 1982-
Latin America -- Politics and government -- 1980-
Amérique latine -- Politique économique
Amérique latine -- Conditions économiques -- 1982-
Amérique latine -- Politique et gouvernement -- 1980-
Economic history
Economic policy
Politics and government
Latin America
Since 1980
publisher: New York ; Oxford : Oxford University Press
description: Understanding Latin America's recent economic performance calls for a multidisciplinary analysis. This handbook looks at the interaction of economics and politics in the region and includes a number of contributions from top academic experts who have also served as key policy makers, reflecting upon the challenges of reform.
contents: Political leadership and economic reform : the Brazilian experience in the context of Latin America / Fernando Henrique Cardoso and Eduardo Graeff -- Politics of fiscal reforms in Peru / Luis Carranza -- The political economy of fiscal policy : the experience of Chile / Andrés Velasco and Eric Parrado -- Industrial policy and economic transformation / Luciano Coutinho [and others] -- Monetary policy under uncertainty / Martin Redrado -- A historical perspective on the political economy of inequality in Latin America / Rosemary Thorp -- Cuban economic policies, 1990-2010 : achievements and shortcomings / Paolo Spadoni -- Global and regional integration in Latin America and the Caribbean, 1990-2010 / Juan Blyde, Antoni Estevadeordal, and Mauricio Mesquita Moreira -- Does Asia matter? The political economy of Latin America's international relations / Barbara Stallings -- A catalyst for hope : China's opportunity for Latin America / Kevin P. Gallagher -- How (not) to produce effective policies? Institutions and policymaking in Latin America / Mariano Tommasi and Carlos Scartascini -- The politics of global financial markets in Latin America / Daniela Campello -- Cabinet stability and policymaking in Latin America / Cecilia Martínez-Gallardo -- International capital markets and their Latin American discontents / Christopher Balding -- Natural resources and democracy in Latin America : neither curse nor blessing / Stephen Haber and Victor Menaldo -- Contrasting capitalisms : Latin America in comparative perspective / Ben Ross Schneider -- Ulysses and the Sirens : political and technical rationality in Latin America / Javier Santiso and Laurence Whitehead -- Killing me softly : local termites and fiscal violence in Brazil and Mexico / Carlos Elizondo and Javier Santiso -- The political economy of public spending and fiscal deficits : lessons for Latin America / Marcela Eslava -- Taxation and democracy in Latin America / Christian Daude and Ángel Melguizo -- Revisiting political budget cycles in Latin America / Sebastián Nieto-Parra and Javier Santiso -- Labor markets in Latin America and the Caribbean : the missing reform / Pablo Egaña and Alejandro Micco.

abstract: Understanding Latin America's recent economic performance calls for a multidisciplinary analysis. This handbook looks at the interaction of economics and politics in the region and includes a number of contributions from top academic experts who have also served as key policy makers, reflecting upon the challenges of reform.
